Subject: Pre and Post Crash Landing
To: nbwrpg@egroups.com

Vehement/Sun Crusher/Reflector:





Vehement watched as bodies floated up through the air, Vehement pushing 
Bloom's headless body away so it floated to the other corner of the bridge.  
He felt a slight tug himself, the gravity generators in the ship offline 
since there power was rerouted to the shields.

"Are scans done?"

"Yes, Archbishop Vehement.  We are entering the upper atmosphere, now." 
Reflector replied.

From the outside of the ship it would look like it was starting to catch fire 
as it seemed to 'dive bomb' downwards towards the surface of the Earth.  In 
truth the ship was just getting extremely hot on the sides and tips.

"How is the hull holding?"

"Holding perfectly, Archbishop."

"Good."

"Brace for impact, Brothers!" Sun Crusher yelled, grabbing a hold of his 
terminal as gravity took full effect, all the floating bodies and scrap 
suddenly slamming to the ground as Earth's gravity took hold.  The ship went 
downward, now in the sky, above what seemed to be an endless filed of gold.  
In reality, it was sand.

The large battle cruiser slammed into the sand front first, looking like it 
was going to flip, but it fell on it's belly, shaking hard, blowing up a wave 
of sand.

Several minutes later, Vehement unharnessed himself, getting to his feet as 
if groggy, feeling mech-fluid leaking from his forehead.  He had no idea how 
that had happened.  
"What in the Pit?" he asked himself, examining the cut further with his 
hands.  He looked and saw a sword near his feat.  

Of course, he thought, the sword must've flew through the air and struck me 
when the ship was crashing.  "REFLECTOR.  SUN CRUSHER.  Are you alrlight my 
Brothers?"

"Yes." Sun Crusher replied, unstrapping himself and getting up.  He was 
unharmed, as was Reflector.

"You're hurt!" Reflector said, pointing to Vehement's wound.

"I know.  I must use a CR chamber.  It should only take a dozen cycles or so, 
it is nothing.  I want a full report when I return." the Archbishop replied, 
heading off to his CR chambers.

"Let's see where we are on Past Earth." Reflector said, checking his 
terminal.  "What will soon be known as Ulaanbaator.  The capital of the 
nation of Mongolia.  Those steppe warriors once held most of Asia and Eastern 
Europe in their grasp.  Then internal feuding caused their eventual downfall."

"Ulaanbaator?"

"It means "Red Hero".  The Mongolians were taken over by Manchuria, and a 
White Russian Army (loyal to the Czar) took possession of Mongolia, easily 
defeating the Manchurian garrison.  A Red Russian Army (Communist) took 
Mongolia, and less then a solar rotation later gave Mongolia its 
independence.  And the USSR helped Mongolia greatly, hence the "Red Hero".  
They had to stop helping Mongolia when they themselves began to bankrupt."

Reflector nodded, storing the information in his data banks, beginning to 
collect the data they had scanned.
